intro: Calycobolus sericeus, commonly known as the silky calycobolus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
